latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

item.title: Dangerous Synthetic Drug Control Act of 2011

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 122.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

summary.text:
Synthetic Drug Abuse Prevention Act of 2012- Amends the Controlled Substances Act to add as schedule I controlled substances: (1) any material, compound, mixture, or preparation which contains specified cannabimimetic agents (or the salts, isomers, or salts of isomers thereof); and (2) specified additional hallucinogenic substances (or the salts, isomers, or salts of isomers thereof).

Extends the period for which the Attorney General may temporarily schedule a substance in schedule I to avoid an imminent hazard to public safety to two years with a one-year extension (currently, one year with a six-month extension).

bill.title: Synthetic Drug Abuse Prevention Act of 2012

item.title: Synthetic Drug Abuse Prevention Act of 2012
Synthetic Drug Abuse Prevention Act of 2012
A bill to amend the Controlled Substances Act to place synthetic drugs in Schedule I.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
